poem:
**Sure Start Again**

In the soft light of morning,  
a whisper echoes through halls of Parliament—  
a nursery rhyme of sure starts  
for tiny hands reaching to touch  
the edges of promise.  
Yet the abacus of power clicks,  
doubting the arithmetic  
of dreams with open ends.  
Still, hope wears a child's smile,  
inviting us to begin anew.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK child poverty taskforce set to recommend return of Sure Start scheme The government-backed child poverty taskforce is likely to recommend the return of the early years service Sure Start, the Guardian understands, though there are doubts in government about whether it could be funded. Senior ministers including Rachel Reeves, Liz Kendall and Bridget Phillipson have praised the service in the past, citing it as one of the crowning achievements of the last Labour government.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
